chargeHist.descr: Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens

result.execSummary:
The defendant Jesse M. Tessmer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.20(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: **Per attached letter file stamped 8-5-15, Court granted eligibility for the Challenge Incarceration Program IF statutorily eligible; therefore defendant is not eligible for CIP or SAP**

superMiscConds.notes:
Pay costs and fees. 
Submit DNA sample and pay $250.00 surcharge if not already done.

Not allowed to vote or sit on jury until sentence is completed.   Absolute sobriety to include no purchase, possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription and taken only as prescribed and as approved by agent.
Any assessments as requested by agent with follow thru.  Court adopts all recommendation/conditions on page 19 of PSI.
